thread.title: Road near inactive Hawaii volcano vent to be cleared of lava
thread.title_full: Road near inactive Hawaii volcano vent to be cleared of lava | The Seattle Times

author: seattletimes.com
title: Road near inactive Hawaii volcano vent to be cleared of lava
text:
HILO, Hawaii (AP) — Hawaii County has called for restoration of a lava-covered road in Pahoa, despite the site having become a popular attraction for tourists.
The Hawaii Tribune-Herald reports (http://bit.ly/1K5uiW1 ) that work on Cemetery Road has been put out to bid and is expected to start in coming months.
Lava crossed the road on Oct. 25 as it stormed through Pahoa and began threatening homes.
The county opened the location up for viewing after the lava flow from Kilauea’s Puu Oo vent became inactive in Pahoa in March.
Most Read Stories ESPN video: Percy Harvin opens up about what went wrong in Seattle Amazon angst: from traffic to housing, we’re all worked up It’s election time. Will Howard Schultz run for president? Godden trailing; 5 incumbents move on for City Council Seahawks safety Kam Chancellor still holding out with no end in sight Project engineer Casey Yanagihara says about 3,500 cubic yards of rock will need to be removed before the road can be repaved.
The Federal Emergency Management Agency is covering 75 percent of the project’s cost, which is estimated at $200,000.
___
Information from: Hawaii Tribune-Herald, http://www.hawaiitribune-herald.com/
The Associated Press
